summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 8, 2019. It documents routine institutional operations, staff leave, and inmate statuses. The most significant entry is the placement of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on psychological observation (Psych Obs) during the evening watch shift.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Psychological Observation
events.description: During the evening watch shift, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was placed on psychological observation (Psych Obs).

events.title: Fire Suppression System Inoperative
events.description: During the day watch shift, the fire suppression system was reported as inoperative, requiring the initiation of a fire watch.

events.title: Staff Shortage Impacts Posts
events.description: Due to a shortage of staff, correctional assignments including Phone Monitor, Sally Officer #3, and 10-South #2 were vacated during both the day and evening watch shifts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
Local Hosp. (Local Hospital, implied to be where inmate #76218-054 was located)
keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was placed on psychological observation (Psych Obs) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The report indicates a staff shortage that led to the vacating of several correctional posts, including one (10-South #2) that was vacated during both the day and evening shifts.
The MCC's fire suppression system was reported as inoperative on July 8, 2019, requiring a fire watch to be initiated.
The document is a routine daily log showing inmate admissions, releases, and institutional totals (790 inmates at the start of the morning watch on July 8, 2019).
Another inmate (not Epstein, but #76218-054) was listed as being at a local hospital under USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guard supervision.
